name: Langchain
description:
Owners: Anudeep Dhonde

Contributors:Spring Wu, Uros Pajic

LangChain is an open-source framework designed to facilitate the development of applications powered by large language models (LLMs). It provides a standardized interface and tools that simplify the process of connecting LLMs to various data sources, external tools, and other APIs. Essentially, LangChain acts as a bridge, enabling developers to build more versatile and powerful AI applications by combining the capabilities of LLMs with external information and functionality.

Projects: MS PURVIEW INVESTIGATION AGENT

Additional links: Langchain

name: Knowledge Graph
description:
Owners: Uros Pajic, Rahul Jha

Contributors: Spring Wu, Anudeep Dhonde,

A knowledge graph is a structured way to represent knowledge as a network of interconnected entities, concepts, and their relationships. Think of it as a database that not only stores information about things but also describes how those things are related to each other, forming a complex web of knowledge.

Projects: MS PURVIEW INVESTIGATION AGENT

Additional links: Knowledge Graph

name: Langgraph
description:
Owners:

Contributors: Spring Wu, Uros Pajic, Sumukha

LangGraph is a library built on top of LangChain that enables the construction of agentic workflows using a directed acyclic graph (DAG) abstraction. It allows for greater control over task execution, state management, and coordination between multiple agents. LangGraph is especially valuable in scenarios where complex multi-step or branching logic is required in LLM applications, including decision-making pipelines and conditional flows. Its modular design makes it a strong candidate for projects experimenting with multi-agent orchestration.

Projects: MS PURVIEW INVESTIGATION AGENT

Additional links: LangGraph

name: Langsmith
description:
Owners: Anudeep Dhonde

Contributors: Spring Wu, Uros Pajic, Sumukha

LangSmith is a powerful platform for debugging, monitoring, and evaluating large language model (LLM) applications developed using LangChain. It provides a user interface and rich API support for visualizing execution traces, evaluating model performance, and understanding LLM behavior over time. LangSmith plays a vital role in productionizing LLM apps by adding observability, test cases, and version control over chain configurations and agent logic.

Projects: MS PURVIEW INVESTIGATION AGENT

Additional links: LangSmith

name: Langfuse
description:
Owners: Anudeep Dhonde

Contributors: Spring Wu, Uros Pajic, Sumukha

Langfuse is an open-source observability and analytics tool for LLM-based applications. It captures traces of user interactions, API calls, prompt completions, and evaluation metrics. By visualizing logs and traces, developers can gain deeper insight into the performance and behavior of their AI systems, enabling root cause analysis and iterative improvements. Langfuse integrates easily with popular frameworks like LangChain and OpenAI SDKs, making it a versatile choice for any LLM stack.

Projects: MS PURVIEW INVESTIGATION AGENT

Additional links: Langfuse

name: Python
description:
Owners: DevTeam

Contributors:DevTeam, Solutions Team

Python is a high-level, versatile, and interpreted programming language known for its readability and ease of use. It's often described as object-oriented and dynamically typed. Python is widely used in various fields, including web development, data science, machine learning, and scripting. Its clear syntax and extensive libraries make it a popular choice for both beginners and experienced programmers.

Projects:

Additional links: Python

name: JavaScript
description:
Owners: DevTeam

Contributors:DevTeam, Solutions Team

JavaScript is the foundational language for interactive web applications. It powers client-side logic in modern browsers and also supports server-side application development via environments like Node.js. JavaScript’s dynamic typing and first-class function support make it highly flexible for rapid front-end and back-end development. Its role in modern frameworks such as React, Angular, and Vue keeps it at the forefront of web technology stacks

Projects:

Additional links: JavaScript

name: Dify
description:
Owners: Anudeep Dhonde

Contributors:Spring Wu

Dify is an open-source platform for developing LLM applications. Its intuitive interface combines agentic AI workflows, RAG pipelines, agent capabilities, model management, observability features, and more—allowing you to quickly move from prototype to production.

Projects:

Additional links: Dify

name: FlowiseAI
description:
Owners: Uros Pajic

Contributors:Spring Wu, Sumukha

Flowise is designed to help in creating AI agents through a simple drag-and-drop interface. It operates by allowing us to connect different blocks, which represent various functions, to build a customized workflow. Each block can be configured to perform a specific action.

Projects:

Additional links: FlowiseAI

name: Angular
description:
Owners: DevTeam

Contributors:DevTeam

Angular is a TypeScript-based web application framework designed for building scalable and maintainable client-side applications. It provides a comprehensive set of tools including dependency injection, routing, HTTP client, and reactive form handling. Angular is a strong choice for enterprise-grade applications and offers long-term support and consistent performance across large codebases

Projects:

Additional links: Angular

name: Data Foundry
description:
Owners: Abhishek Mukherji, Bishwajith

Contributors:Solutions Team

Data Foundry is a flexible and extensible data annotation platform supporting a wide range of data types including text, audio, images, and time series. It supports both manual and programmatic labeling and integrates with model inference pipelines to enable active learning. Data Foundry is widely used in AI teams for curating high-quality datasets for model training, validation, and evaluation.

Projects: Gaia, Steelcase

Additional links: Data Foundry

name: Oneforma
description:
Owners: Shashi Shashidhar

Contributors:Solutions Team

OneForma is a flexible and extensible data annotation platform supporting a wide range of data types including text, audio, images, and time series. It supports both manual and programmatic labeling and integrates with model inference pipelines to enable active learning. Data Foundry is widely used in AI teams for curating high-quality datasets for model training, validation, and evaluation.

Projects: Botanix

Additional links: OneForma

name: AI Data Foundry
description:
Owners: Robin Dautricourt

Contributors:Solutions Team

AI Data Foundry is a full-stack, enterprise-grade platform that enables organizations to build, fine-tune, deploy, and govern AI systems at scale with high quality and compliance. It supports end-to-end workflows—from data ingestion and curation to model training, evaluation, and monitoring—while accommodating multimodal inputs like text, audio, images, video, and 3D data. Designed for agentic AI, it includes over 150 built-in quality and safety checks, red/purple teaming, and human-in-the-loop oversight.

Projects: Tmobile

Additional links: AI Data Foundry

name: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
description:
Owners: Robin Dautricourt

Contributors:Solutions Team

RAG is a hybrid NLP architecture that combines document retrieval with generative models. It uses a retriever component to find relevant documents and passes them to a generator (such as GPT or BERT) for response synthesis. RAG reduces hallucination in LLMs and supports grounded generation.

Projects: Tmobile

Additional links: HuggingFace RAG

name: Semantic Chunking
description:
Owners: DevTeam

Contributors:DevTeam

Semantic chunking involves breaking down large documents into meaning-preserving text segments for embedding and retrieval. This technique improves vector search accuracy and is critical for building effective RAG pipelines. Unlike fixed-length chunking, semantic methods consider topic boundaries and sentence coherence

Projects:

Additional links: Semantic Chunking

name: Jfrog
description:
Owners: Vijayakumar Thirunavukarasu

Contributors:Raviprakash VR

JFrog is a software company that provides an end-to-end platform for managing and distributing software artifacts throughout the software development lifecycle. JFrog solves the problem to keep artifacts in central repository where all these packages can be stored, versioned, scanned for security, and easily pulled when needed.
